results.title: The Bostonians
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Merchant Ivory Productions and Ismail Merchant
results.brief_description: A Merchant Ivory adaptation of Henry James’ novel in which the young, but charismatic Verena is forced to choose between her loyalty to the women’s suffragette movement, represented by her mentor, Olive (Vanessa Redgrave), and the passionate attention of Olive’s cousin (Christopher Reeve) who represents everything that Olive abhors. Ruth Prawer Jhabvala adapted the novel for the screen and the film co-stars Linda Hunt and Jessica Tandy.

results.title: The Boston strangler
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Robert Fryer and Richard Fleischer
results.brief_description: Based on a true story this 70’s thriller is a powerful and horrifying police drama. It follows the story of the hunt for a serial killer who has raped and murdered dozens of women in the Boston area. Rapists and sexual offenders are dragged from the street to undergo interrogation in the hope of finding the killer. Disturbing and tense this film is extremely well acted, and uses the then fashionable multi-image technique. A docudrama that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Cast includes Tony Curtis, Henry Fonda, Hurd Hatfield and George Kennedy.

results.title: The Book of life
results.creator_credit: Haut et Court, La Sept, Arte, Thierry Cagianut, Matt Myers and Hal Hartley
results.brief_description: In the late 1990s a French production company invited several directors to make a short feature about the last day of the millennium; Hal Hartley (the only American to be asked) created a film about Jesus Christ descending to earth to unleash a series of plagues that will end humanity. He is accompanied on this journey by Mary Magdalene (played by English rock icon PJ Harvey) and is forced to face the devil (Thomas Jay Ryan) who has also arrived in New York seeking a showdown with his nemesis. As Jesus retrieves the book (which, in a clever update, is a notebook computer) the devil sits in a bar discussing the merits of humanity with a barmaid and a compulsive gambler. Hartley utilises an array of video and digital techniques, blurring the visuals, speeding them up, slowing them down which creates an effective sense of disorientation and doom. Hartley mainstay Martin Donovan is typically diffident in the role of Jesus.

results.title: The Bonfire of the vanities
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description:
Brian De Palma’s adaptation of Tom Wolfe’s tome to political corruption and greed in New York City was an unmitigated disaster for the filmmaker and all involved. Playing against type, Tom Hanks was cast as Sherman McCoy, a slick Wall Street trader, who immersed in the high-pressure world of stocks and bonds, enjoys reaping the financial rewards of his job. But Sherman’s Achilles heel is his extramarital affair with Maria Ruskin, a buxom Southern belle, who amuses Sherman with her uneducated speech, but reveals a ruthless streak when she runs over a black teenager in Harlem and Sherman is sent to trial. It is drunken reporter Peter Fallow who uncovers the scandal, despite misgivings about the motivations of the players who help him. Unfortunately, encapsulating the many strains of Wolfe’s novel proved too complex for the script, which leaves many characters as ciphers and fails to flesh out the motivations of the central players. Nevertheless, within the context of the extravagant, tasteless excesses of the 1980s, the film serves as an intriguing tableau of corruptibility, vice, greed and human foibles.
Cast includes: Tom Hanks, Bruce Willis, Melanie Griffith, Kim Cattrall, Morgan Freeman, F. Murray Abraham

results.title: The Bone collector [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Universal Pictures, Martin Bregman, Louis A. Stroller, Michael S. Bregman and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description: Based on Jeffrey Deaver’s best selling novel, Officer Donaghy (Angelina Jolie) stumbles upon a bizarre murder scene. Her inexperience as a police officer bears no hindrance to the professional way she deals with the evidence, which catches the eye of paralyzed detective Lincoln Rhyme (Denzel Washington). Donaghy and Rhyme become embroiled in what eventuates as an incomprehensible slate of brutish murders where clues can only be unravelled in one place - the mind of the murderer. Cinematography by Dean Semler.

results.title: The Body snatcher
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Val Lewton and Robert Wise
results.brief_description: Atmospheric horror film based on a Robert Louis Stevenson short story. Set in Edinburgh of 1831, a gifted doctor who runs a medical school is haunted by a grave robber who supplied corpses to research scientists and once protected him from a prison term. Cast includes Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi and Henry Daniell.

results.title: The Blue kite
results.brief_description: The fate of a Beijing family under Mao Tse Tung’s regime from the early 1950’s to the Cultural Revolution is the focus of this film by talented filmaker Tian Zhuangzhuang. Seen from the perspective of Tietou who grows from child to adolescence as he observes his mother’s three marriages. Although epic in proportion, the intimacy of domestic life is a poignant contrast to the political dramas occuring. The film was banned in China but a print was smuggled out of the country allowing the rest of the world an opportunity to experience this inspirational human drama.

results.title: The Blue angel = Der Blaue engel (Director's cut) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universum Film, Erich Pommer and Josef von Sternberg
results.brief_description: The Blue angel is the film that made an international star of German actress Marlene Dietrich. Directed by Josef von Sternberg (the first of their eight collaborations), “The Blue angel” is a tale of love, obsession and madness. Lola (Dietrich) is an exotic singer and dancer in a nightclub, enthralling men nightly with her erotic routines. A straight laced and humourless professor (Emil Jannings) at a local school attends the club one evening in the hope of catching some of his errant students there. Lola, who beguiles him with her charms, immediately ensnares the Professor. The unlikely two form a romantic entanglement despite Lola’s offhand manner towards him. What follows is a tragic story of an ill-begotten match. Dietrich made her name with this film with her inimitable style, establishing her signature tune - “Falling in love again”. The tone of the film reflects the depressed state that Germany was in at that time - still suffering the after effects of World War One reparations. Sternberg displays his flair for visual expressiveness and moody atmosphere that he would continue to nurture throughout his career.

results.title: The Blob
results.creator_credit: Valley Forge Films Studios, Jack H. Harris and Irvin S. Yeaworth
results.brief_description: The uncut colour version of the cult Sci-Fi film that established McQueen’s star quality. A small town becomes engulfed in terror when a meteorite crashes in a lonely field. McQueen and his girlfriend must convince the townsfolk to action but face total disbelief and ridicule towards what seems a fabrication by confused kids. A slimy alien gel begins swallowing people and growing larger. Classic scenes include a packed cinema screening a horror movie when the slimy gel seeps from the projector window causing an unforgetable exit of panic. Starring Steve McQueen, Aneta Corseaut and Earl Rowe. Co-starring Olin Howlin, Steven Chase and John Benson. Includes rare career highlights of Steve McQueen including famous film and television roles such as “Wanted: Dead or Alive”, “The Great Escape” and “The Defender” (with an early William “Star Trek” Shatner) and a very brief interview in relation to his off-screen dare-devil motor bike racing.

results.title: The Black swan
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Robert Bassler and Henry King
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Spanish Main - when villainy wore a sash and the only political creed in the world was - Love, Gold and Adventure! Tyrone Power is a swashbucking rogue pirate who pillages galleons and towns in the company of Henry Morgan (Laird Cregar). When Morgan is elected Govenor of Jamaica, some of his pirate Captains continue their villainous ways, especially Redbeard (George Sanders). Power falls in love with the beautiful daughter (Maureen O’Hara) of the former Govenor and decides to reform which pits him against Redbeard. “The Black Swan” is a classic of its kind, with magnificent settings, swordplay, bravura acting and excitingly staged action sequences involving 17th Century ships and an enormous amount of cannon fire! Leon Shamroy’s cinematography deservedly earned him an Oscar. Based on the novel by Rafael Sabatini.
